   345.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   (a)   No sight-seeing car shall operate for hire or reward upon the streets
of the City without obtaining a license from the City of Hamilton Finance
Department. Such license shall be issued for the calendar year and shall expire
on December 31 of each year, unless sooner suspended or revoked by the Finance
Department.
   (b)   Application for a license for sight-seeing cars shall be made by the
owner upon blank forms furnished by the Finance Department, and shall contain
the full name and address of the owner, the type of vehicle for which a license
is desired, the number of persons it is capable of carrying, and the motor
power thereof, together with a certificate of liability insurance required
under the provisions of Section
345.04.
(Ord. 2017-8-91. Passed 8-23-17.)
   345.03 INSPECTION.
   No sight-seeing car shall be licensed until the same has been thoroughly and
carefully inspected, examined and found to be in a thoroughly safe condition
for the transportation of passengers, clean, fit, of good appearance and well
painted or varnished. Such inspection shall be made by a representative of the
City of Hamilton Police Department before issuing such license, and he or she
may make such additional inspections as in his or her judgment are necessary.
The Police Department shall refuse a license to, or revoke or suspend the
license of any vehicle found by him or her to be unfit or unsuited for public
patronage. The Police Department is hereby authorized and empowered to
establish reasonable rules and regulations for the inspection and operation of
sight-seeing cars, their appurtenances, construction and conditional fitness.
(Ord. 2017-8-91. Passed 8-23-17.)
   345.04 LIABILITY INSURANCE.
   No person shall operate a sight-seeing car or other vehicle as defined in
this chapter or permit such to be operated; nor shall any license be issued
hereunder until and unless the applicant for a license hereunder deposits with
the Finance Department a policy or certificate of commercial general liability
insurance for each sight-seeing car for which a license is sought, acceptable
and approved by the Finance Department and the Director of Law, insuring the
applicant against bodily injury and property damage with limits of one million
dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence, two million dollars ($2,000,000) annual
aggregate. The policy shall afford coverage to the City of Hamilton as an
additional insured. The issuing insurer shall give ten (10) days written notice
before cancellation of the policy to the Finance Department. Any license issued
under this Chapter shall expire upon the lapse or termination of the policy of
insurance.
(Ord. 2017-8-91. Passed 8-23-17.)
   345.05 LICENSE CARD. 
   Any sight-seeing car which has been found upon inspection to be of lawful
construction and proper condition in accordance with this chapter and rules and
regulations established thereunder and upon the payment of the license fees
hereinafter set forth shall be licensed by delivering to the owner a card of
such size and form as may be prescribed by the City of Hamilton Finance
Department. The card shall contain an official license number together with
date of inspection of such vehicle and the statement that in case of any
complaints, the Police Department shall be notified. Such card shall be signed
by a representative from the Police Department and contain blank spaces upon
which entry shall be made of the date of every inspection. The number of such
card shall correspond with the license number of such vehicle, and shall be
displayed conspicuously in the sight-seeing car as prescribed by the Finance
Department.
(Ord. 2017-8-91. Passed 8-23-17.)
   345.06 FEES FOR SIGHT-SEEING CARS.
   (a)   The following license fee shall be paid in advance for each vehicle
license:
 
VEHICLE CAPACITY FEE
12 or Less       $100.00
13 to 20         $150.00
Over 20          $200.00
   (b)   Any licensee upon payment of any of the above fees, shall be entitled
to operate as sight-seeing cars during such year additional vehicles for which
sight-seeing car licenses have been issued and are in effect or which are
otherwise licensed for the transportation of persons for hire in the City of
Hamilton, upon payment of an additional annual fee of five dollars ($5.00) for
each such vehicle; provided the Director of Law is satisfied that the public
liability insurance on such vehicle covers or is made to include the operation
thereof for sight-seeing purposes.
   (c)   No transfer of a license shall be permitted except with the consent of
the Finance Department, which consent shall be endorsed on the original
license. The Finance Department shall permit a transfer only when it appears
that one (1) of the cars owned and operated by the licensee is retired,
destroyed, demolished or otherwise rendered unfit for service.
   (d)   Upon a finding by the City of Hamilton Finance Department that an
extraordinary demand upon any special occasion requires the use of more sight-
seeing vehicles by any person, firm or corporation to whom there has been
issued one (1) or more sight-seeing licenses for the calendar year, the Finance
Department may issue special permits, valid for a period not to exceed twenty-
four (24) hours, upon the payment of a fee of one dollar ($1.00) each for the
use of additional vehicles which are duly licensed for the transportation of
persons for hire and which carry public liability insurance satisfactory to the
Director of Law.
(Ord. 2017-8-91. Passed 8-23-17.)
   345.07 SIGHT-SEEING CAR OPERATOR'S LICENSE.
   (a)   Every person driving a sight-seeing car shall be licensed as a sight-
seeing car operator and each applicant for such license must:
      (1)   Be licensed by the State of Ohio to operate a motor vehicle;
      (2)   Be eighteen (18) years of age or over;
      (3)   State the type or types of carriage the applicant will be driving;
      (4)   Provide two (2) front face photographs of the applicant taken
within thirty (30) days of the date of the application. The photographs shall
be two (2) inches by two (2) inches in size; and,
      (5)   Provide such other information as the Finance Department may
require.
   (b)   No sight-seeing car operator's license shall be issued to an applicant
who makes a false statement in connection with an application for such license.
   (c)   A Sight-Seeing Car Operator's license shall be issued for the calendar
year and shall expire on December 31 of each year, unless sooner, suspended or
revoked by the Finance Department.
(Ord. 2017-8-91. Passed 8-23-17.)
   345.08 FEES FOR SIGHT-SEEING CAR OPERATOR'S LICENSE.
   A fee of ten dollars ($10.00) each shall be paid for issuance of a sight-
seeing car operator's license or its renewal.
(Ord. 2017-8-91. Passed 8-23-17.)
   345.09 REGULATION OF SIGHT-SEEING CARS.
   (a)   No sight-seeing car may operate in or upon the public rights-of-way of
the City without displaying its sight-seeing car license.
   (b)   No sight-seeing car operator may operate a sight-seeing car without
having the sight-seeing car operator's license issued pursuant to Section
345.07 upon his or her person.
   (c)   The use of sight-seeing cars shall be limited to sight-seeing
purposes. The transportation for sight-seeing purposes afforded thereby shall
not be subject to the direction or control of passengers. Sight-seeing cars
shall not be used to carry passengers or property for hire to or from any
railroad station, airport, steamboat landing or dock, except as incident to
sight-seeing trips, nor shall they be used in any manner which will compete
with transportation services rendered or designed to be rendered by motor buses
or other agencies of mass or public transportation.
   (d)   A schedule of rates charged for a trip by a sight-seeing car, the
route traversed, the time consumed and the time of departure shall be
prominently displayed at the starting point of the sight-seeing car and upon a
sign attached to the front of the sight-seeing car before the trip starts. The
sign may also be displayed on the sidewalk in such manner as the Director of
Engineering determines. The sign shall display the prices of the trip in
letters or figures at least four (4) inches in height. A charge or an attempt
to charge any passenger a sum greater than set forth in such schedule shall be
deemed a violation of this section. A sight-seeing car, after leaving its
starting point, shall not receive additional passengers between such place of
starting and its ultimate destination point. The routes over which sight-seeing
cars may be operated shall be subject to the approval of the City of Hamilton
Department of Engineering and the Police Department on an annual basis.
   (e)   Only sight-seeing cars in such numbers as provided herein shall remain
while awaiting employment, at the route start or stop points approved by the
City of Hamilton Department of Engineering pursuant to Section
345.09(b). The Engineering Department shall determine the number and location
of any public stands, and shall establish such further regulations not
inconsistent with the provisions of this chapter as the Director of that
Department deems necessary.
   (f)   No sight-seeing car operator shall smoke while operating a sight-
seeing car that is carrying passengers.
   (g)   No sight-seeing car operator shall permit the occupancy of the sight-
seeing car which he or she is operating to exceed the rated seating capacity of
that sight-seeing car.
   (h)   Each sight-seeing car operator shall ensure that all of his or her
passengers are seated inside the sight-seeing car when the sight-seeing car is
in motion.
   (i)   Sight-seeing cars shall be operated as near to the right side of the
roadway as practicable, shall obey all traffic laws, rules and regulations
applicable to motor vehicles, and shall exercise due care when passing a
standing vehicle or a vehicle which is proceeding in the same direction.
(Ord. 2017-8-91. Passed 8-23-17.)
   345.10 SPECIFICALLY CHARTED SIGHT-SEEING CARS.
   The owner of a sight-seeing car licensed as provided in this chapter may
load or unload a group of passengers at such point or points in the City as may
have been agreed upon in advance by the person, firm or corporation chartering
such sight-seeing car for any special or regular sight-seeing tour subject to
the approval of the City of Hamilton Engineering Department or the Police
Department.
(Ord. 2017-8-91. Passed 8-23-17.)
   345.11 LICENSE SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION; APPEAL.
   (a)   In addition to any penalty imposed and authorized by any section of
this chapter, the Finance Department may at any time suspend any license
granted under authority of this chapter for failure to comply with the
provisions of this chapter or with any other applicable laws or regulations of
the City or the State of Ohio. A suspended license may be reinstated within
fifteen (15) days of its suspension if the reason for the suspension is cured
by the licensee. Any license that is not reinstated within fifteen (15) days of
its suspension shall be deemed revoked.
   (b)   Whenever the Finance Department refuses to issue or revokes a license,
the Finance Department shall issue written notice of the refusal or application
to the applicant or licensee. The notice shall be served on the applicant or
licensee personally or by United States certified mail or commercial carrier
service to the address provided by the applicant or licensee to the Finance
Department. If the certified mail is returned undelivered or the commercial
carrier service reports a failure of delivery, a copy shall be served by
regular mail. If notice is sent by regular mail, it shall be evidenced by a
certificate of mailing and shall be deemed received three (3) business days
from the date of mailing.
   (c)   Whenever the Finance Department refuses to issue or revokes a license,
the applicant or licensee shall have the right to appeal. To appeal, a licensee
must file a written appeal with the office of the Finance Department within
thirty (30) days of the failure to issue or revocation. The written appeal must
set forth the complete name, address, and telephone number of the licensee and
a brief statement of the grounds for the appeal. The licensee shall be granted
a hearing on the appeal before an administrative hearing officer no later than
thirty (30) days after receipt of the appeal. The failure of the licensee or
his or her representative to appear and state his or her case at such hearing
shall have the same effect as if no appeal had been filed. After a hearing, the
administrative hearing officer shall sustain, modify, or withdraw the failure
to issue or revocation of the license. The administrative hearing officer shall
issue his or her findings and decision, in writing, within ten (10) business
days to the licensee and the Director of the Finance Department. The findings
and decision of the administrative hearing officer shall constitute a final
order to the licensee.
(Ord. 2017-8-91. Passed 8-23-17.)
   345.99 PENALTIES.
   Any person who violates any provision of this chapter for which a penalty is
not already provided in another section of this Traffic Code is guilty of a
minor degree misdemeanor and shall be fined not more than One hundred dollars
($100.00). In addition to any other method of enforcement provided for in this
chapter, any violation of the provisions of this chapter which is a minor
misdemeanor may be enforced by the issuance of a citation in compliance with
Rule 4.1 of the Ohio Rules of Criminal Procedure.
(Ord. 2017-8-91. Passed 8-23-17.)
CHAPTER 347
Carriages
347.01   Definitions.
347.02   License required.
347.03   License applications.
347.04   Fees.
347.05   Insurance.
347.06   Route map and operations schedule.
347.07   License issuance and renewal.
347.08   Regulations governing carriages and carriage businesses.
347.09   Impounding of horses.
347.10   Suspension and revocation of license; appeal.
347.99   Penalties.
CROSS REFERENCES
Site seeing cars - see TRAF. Ch.
345
   347.01 DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   "Carriage" means a horse-drawn or manually- or mechanically-driven
vehicle the owner or operator of which secures or accepts passengers for hire
on public streets or in public or quasi-public places, including, but not
limited to, horse-drawn carriages, pedal-propelled carriages, and pedicabs.
   (b)   "Carriage Operator" means the person in actual physical control of a
carriage.
   (c)   "Carriage Operator's Assistant" means the person required by division
(b) of Section
347.08 to assist the Carriage Operator with those duties which are ancillary to
the operation of the carriage.
   (d)   "Carriage Business" means the business of transporting persons for
hire by carriage.
   (e)   "Operate for hire" includes "plying for hire" and "carrying passengers
for hire" and means the engaging by any person, firm or corporation, directly
or through any agent, lessee, representative, officer or employee in the
business of transporting persons, or of providing or furnishing such
transportation service, for hire to the public generally or under special or
individual contracts, over the streets and highways of the City, and also
includes the soliciting of public patronage upon the streets and highways of
the City, the demanding, accepting or receiving of any compensation,
remuneration, reward, gift, donation, gratuity, tip or other consideration, for
transporting any person or persons over the public streets of this City.
(Ord. 2017-8-92. Passed 8-23-17.)
   347.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   (a)   No person shall operate any carriage upon the public rights of way of
the City without a carriage license and a carriage operator's license, each
issued pursuant to Section
347.07.
   (b)   No person shall operate a carriage business in the City without a
carriage business license issued pursuant to Section
347.07.
   (c)   A carriage operator or business that operates, without charging the
public a fee, as part of a special event that lasts less than three (3)
consecutive days shall be exempt from the license fee requirements of Section
347.04 but shall comply with all other provisions in this chapter unless
specifically exempted.
(Ord. 2017-8-92. Passed 8-23-17.)
   347.03 LICENSE APPLICATIONS.
   (a)   Carriage Business Licenses:  The application for a carriage business
license shall be made to the City of Hamilton Finance Department on forms to be
prescribed by the Finance Department, and shall contain the following
information:
      (1)   The name and business address of the applicant;
      (2)   The number of carriages to be operated by the carriage business;
      (3)   A schedule of rates and charges to be made to passengers;
      (4)   A statement signed by the applicant that the applicant will operate
the carriage business strictly in accordance with the provisions of this
chapter and other applicable provisions of these Codified Ordinances;
      (5)   The route map and operations schedule described in Section
347.06;
      (6)   Such other information as the Finance Department may require.
   No carriage business license shall be issued to an owner of a carriage
business who makes a false statement in connection with an application for a
business license. No carriage business license shall be issued to a business
which will transport persons for hire in horse-drawn carriages until the Chief
of Police or his or her designee has inspected every horse that will pull such
carriages and has determined that each horse complies with the requirements of
division (j) of Section
347.08. After a carriage business license has been issued to a business which
transports persons for hire in horse-drawn carriages and a new horse is
acquired for such purpose, the licensee shall have the new horse inspected by
the Chief of Police or his or her designee to determine that the horse complies
with the requirements of division (j) of Section
347.08 prior to using the horse in the business.
   (b)   Carriage Licenses:
      (1)   The application for a carriage license shall be made to the Finance
Department on forms to be prescribed by the Finance Department, and shall
contain the following information:
         A.   The name and address of the carriage's owner;
         B.   The number of persons the carriage is capable of carrying; and
         C.   Such other information as the Finance Department may require.
      (2)   No carriage other than a horse-drawn carriage shall be licensed
until the City of Hamilton Police Department has inspected the carriage, and no
horse-drawn carriage shall be licensed until the Chief of Police or his or her
designee has inspected the carriage. Any such inspection shall determine that,
consistent with the standards set forth herein, the carriage is clean, sightly,
and in such condition as to be completely safe for the transporting of
passengers. Only those carriages which contain the following equipment may be
licensed:
         A.   On the rear of the carriage, brakes, brake lights, tail lights,
and turn signals;
         B.   On each side of the front of the carriage, lights that emit light
to the front and to the side, and that are visible from a distance of five
hundred (500) feet; and
         C.   Attached to the rear of the vehicle, a "slow-moving vehicle" sign
approved by the State of Ohio.
   (c)   Carriage Operator's License: The application for a carriage operator's
license shall be made to the Finance Department, and each applicant for such
license must:
      (1)   Be licensed by the State of Ohio to operate a motor vehicle;
      (2)   Be eighteen (18) years of age or over;
      (3)   State the type or types of carriage the applicant will be driving;
      (4)   Provide two (2) front face photographs of the applicant taken
within thirty (30) days of the date of the application. The photographs shall
be two (2) inches by two (2) inches in size; and,
      (5)   Provide such other information as the Finance Department may
require.
   No carriage operator's license shall be issued to an applicant who makes a
false statement in connection with an application for such license.
(Ord. 2017-8-92. Passed 8-23-17.)
   347.04 FEES.
   The following license fees shall be paid to the Finance Department when the
applications to which they apply are submitted:
   (a)   Carriage Business License.
 
Initial License Fee $150.00
Annual Renewal Fee  $150.00
 
   (b)   Carriage License.
 
Initial License Fee Per Vehicle $25.00
Annual Renewal Fee Per Vehicle  $25.00
 
   (c)   Carriage Operator's License.
 
Initial License Fee $10.00
Annual Renewal Fee  $10.00
 
(Ord. 2017-8-92. Passed 8-23-17.)
   347.05 INSURANCE.
   No person shall operate a carriage, as defined in this chapter, or permit
such to be operated; nor shall any license be issued hereunder until and unless
the applicant for a license hereunder deposits with the Finance Department a
policy or certificate of commercial general liability insurance for each
carriage for which a license is sought, acceptable and approved by the Finance
Department and the Director of Law, insuring the applicant against bodily
injury and property damage with limits of one million dollars ($1,000,000) per
occurrence, Two million dollars ($2,000,000) annual aggregate. The policy shall
afford coverage to the City of Hamilton as an additional insured. The issuing
insurer shall give ten (10) days written notice before cancellation of the
policy to the Finance Department. Any license issued under this Chapter shall
expire upon the lapse or termination of the policy of insurance.
(Ord. 2017-8-92. Passed 8-23-17.)
   347.06 ROUTE MAP AND OPERATIONS SCHEDULE.
   (a)   A carriage business shall operate only upon routes and under schedules
which have been submitted to and approved by, on an annual basis, the Director
of Engineering and the Chief of Police, or his or her designee.
   (b)   The route map and operations schedule shall be filed with the
application for a carriage business license and shall contain the following:
      (1)   A map of the routes on which the carriage(s) will operate;
      (2)   The location of any curbside areas to be designated as zones for
pickup and discharge of passengers;
      (3)   With respect to horse-drawn carriages, the location of the site or
sites to be used for off-street storage, stabling and loading of carriages and
horses;
      (4)   With respect to pedal-propelled carriages and pedicabs, the route
map shall consist of a designated area in which point-to-point transportation
of passengers shall be permitted, and operations schedule shall state the hours
of service of the carriage business.
   (c)   The Director of Engineering and the Chief of Police, or his or her
designee, may reject any route map and operations schedule implementation of
which would result in the unsafe use of public rights-of-way or an unreasonable
impediment to the orderly flow of traffic.
   (d)   The licensee may add additional routes from time to time, provided
that they have been submitted to and approved by the Director of Engineering
and the Chief of Police, or his or her designee.
   (e)   Nothing in this section shall be construed to prohibit a licensee from
operating on special routes for special events, including without limitation
weddings, dinner-and-theater packages, concerts and other performances,
provided that the routes have first been submitted to and approved by the
Director of Engineering and the Chief of Police, or his or her designee.
(Ord. 2017-8-92. Passed 8-23-17.)
   347.07 LICENSE ISSUANCE AND RENEWAL.
   (a)   Carriage Business Licenses:  Upon receipt of the application required
by division (a) of Section
347.03, the fee required by division (a) of Section
347.04 and the insurance policy required by Section
347.05, the Finance Department shall issue a carriage business license which,
unless sooner revoked or suspended pursuant to Section
347.10, shall be issued for the calendar year and shall expire on December 31.
The Finance Department shall issue to the licensee a number of copies of the
carriage business license equal to that number of carriages for which the owner
of the carriage business obtains licenses pursuant to division (b) of this
Section
347.07.
   (b)   Carriage Licenses:
      (1)   In order to prevent disruption of the use of public rights-of-way
by motor vehicles and pedestrians, the number of carriage licenses shall at no
time exceed twenty (20). Carriage licenses shall be issued by the Finance
Department on a first-come first-served basis.
      (2)   Upon receipt of the application required by division (b) of Section
347.03 and the fee required by division (b) of Section
347.04, and upon a satisfactory conclusion to the inspection required by
division (c) of Section
347.03, the Finance Department shall issue a carriage license which, unless
sooner revoked or suspended pursuant to Section
347.10, shall be issued for the calendar year and shall expire on December 31.
   (c)   Carriage Operator's Licenses: Upon receipt of the application required
by division (d) of Section
347.03 and the fee required by division (c) of Section
347.04, the Finance Department shall issue a carriage operator's license which
shall contain the photograph of the applicant and which, unless sooner revoked
or suspended pursuant to Section
347.10, shall be issued for the calendar year and shall expire on December 31.
   (d)   Licenses issued pursuant to this chapter are not transferrable, but
each license may be renewed from year to year upon filing of a renewal
application and payment of the renewal fee specified in Section
347.04, provided that the Finance Department determines that the business,
carriage, or operator, as the case may be, continues to meet the requirements
for initial issuance contained in Section
347.03. No license shall be issued to an applicant who makes a false statement
in connection with an application for a license pursuant to this Chapter.
(Ord. 2017-8-92. Passed 8-23-17.)
   347.08 REGULATIONS GOVERNING CARRIAGES AND CARRIAGE BUSINESSES.
   (a)   No carriage may operate in or upon the public rights-of-way of the
City without displaying its carriage license and its carriage business license,
unless exempt under division (c) of Section
347.02 from the license requirements.
   (b)   No carriage operator may operate a carriage without having the
carriage operator's license issued pursuant to division (d) of Section
347.07 upon his or her person, unless exempt under division (c) of Section
347.02 from the license requirements. When passengers are being picked up or
discharged by a horse-drawn carriage, a carriage operator's assistant shall
assist the carriage operator so that the carriage operator may devote his or
her attention entirely to operating the carriage and keeping the horse and
carriage under secure control.
   (c)   Every carriage business shall provide each of its carriages with rate
cards which set forth the rates and charges filed with the Finance Department
pursuant to division (a)(3) of Section
347.03 unless exempt under division (c) of Section
347.02 from the license requirements. Rate cards shall be prominently displayed
within each carriage, and each carriage operator shall acquaint all prospective
passengers with current rates and charges prior to taking on said passengers.
Rates shall not be changed without ten (10) days prior written notice to the
Finance Department.
   (d)   No carriage operator or carriage operator's assistant shall solicit
passengers in a loud voice or in such a manner as to annoy or obstruct the
movement of any person; nor shall any carriage operator pursue any person for
purposes of soliciting patronage.
   (e)   No carriage operator or carriage operator's assistant shall smoke
while operating a carriage that is carrying passengers.
   (f)   No carriage operator shall permit the occupancy of the carriage which
he or she is operating to exceed the rated seating capacity of that carriage.
   (g)   Each carriage operator shall ensure that all of his or her passengers
are seated inside the carriage when the carriage is in motion.
   (h)   Carriages shall be operated as near to the right side of the roadway
as practicable, shall obey all traffic laws, rules and regulations applicable
to motor vehicles, and shall exercise due care when passing a standing vehicle
or a vehicle which is proceeding in the same direction.
   (i)   Horse-drawn carriages shall pick up and discharge passengers only
while legally parked at the curb in zones established by the Director of Public
Safety after consultation with the Engineering Department. All other carriages
may pick up and discharge passengers anywhere along their approved routes,
provided that they are legally parked at the curb when doing so.
   (j)   All horse-drawn carriage business owners and horse-drawn carriage
operators shall maintain their horses in accordance with the following
standards of animal husbandry:
      (1)   No person shall operate a horse-drawn carriage when the
temperature, as reported by the National Weather Service exceeds eighty-five
degrees Fahrenheit (85°F).
      (2)   No person shall work any one (1) horse more than six (6) hours per
day.
      (3)   Every horse-drawn carriage owner shall properly fit or cause to be
fitted each of his or her horses with rubber shoes.
      (4)   Every horse-drawn carriage business owner and every horse-drawn
carriage operator shall ensure that his or her horses are properly watered and
given a ten (10) minute rest period for every hour of use, are in good health
and at a proper body weight, are not more than fifteen (15) years old, and are
properly fitted with harness and tack.
      (5)   Every horse-drawn carriage business owner shall ensure that
emergency veterinary treatment is available for his or her horse.
   (k)   Every six (6) months, commencing with the date of the application
submitted pursuant to division (b) of Section
347.03, a carriage license holder shall submit to the Chief of Police, or his
or her designee, a medical certificate for each horse used by the carriage
license holder in the operation of horse-drawn carriages. The medical
certificate shall be signed b
y a registered veterinarian and shall indicate that the horse is medically fit,
in good health both physically and by temperament, sufficient to pull a horse-
drawn carriage, and has received all those inoculations which are determined to
be usual and customary according to generally-accepted principles of animal
husbandry.
   (l)   Every horse-drawn carriage operator shall ensure that, whenever his or
her horses are upon the public rights-of-way, each of them is fitted with a
device which prevents the horse's feces from dropping to the ground.
(Ord. 2017-8-92. Passed 8-23-17.)
   347.09 IMPOUNDING OF HORSES.
   (a)   Whenever a horse-drawn carriage is impounded, the Chief of Police or
his or her designee is authorized to provide for the removal of the horse to an
appropriate stable and to care for such horse until such time as the person who
is entitled to possession of the carriage has secured its release in accordance
with the Traffic Code.
   (b)   Fees shall be assessed against the owner or other person claiming an
impounded horse:
 
Impounding       $60.00
Storage and Care Customary daily charge of the stable operator
(Ord. 2017-8-92. Passed 8-23-17.)
   347.10 SUSPENSION AND REVOCATION OF LICENSE: APPEAL.
   (a)   The Finance Department may at any time suspend any license granted
under authority of this chapter for failure to comply with the provisions of
this chapter or with any other applicable laws or regulations of the City or
the State of Ohio. A suspended license may be reinstated within fifteen (15)
days of its suspension if the reason for the suspension is cured by the
licensee. Any license that is not reinstated within fifteen (15) days of its
suspension shall be deemed revoked.
   (b)   Whenever the Finance Department refuses to issue or revokes a license,
the Finance Department shall issue written notice of the refusal or application
to the applicant or licensee. The notice shall be served on the applicant or
licensee personally or by United States certified mail or commercial carrier
service to the address provided by the applicant or licensee to the Finance
Department. If the certified mail is returned undelivered or the commercial
carrier service reports a failure of delivery, a copy shall be served by
regular mail. If notice is sent by regular mail, it shall be evidenced by a
certificate of mailing and shall be deemed received three (3) business days
from the date of mailing.
   (c)   Whenever the Finance Department refuses to issue or revokes a license,
the applicant or licensee shall have the right to appeal. To appeal, a licensee
must file a written appeal with the office of the Finance Department within
thirty (30) days of the failure to issue or revocation. The written appeal must
set forth the complete name, address, and telephone number of the licensee and
a brief statement of the grounds for the appeal. The licensee shall be granted
a hearing on the appeal before an administrative hearing officer no later than
thirty (30) days after receipt of the appeal. The failure of the licensee or
his or her representative to appear and state his or her case at such hearing
shall have the same effect as if no appeal had been filed. After a hearing, the
administrative hearing officer shall sustain, modify, or withdraw the failure
to issue or revocation of the license. The administrative hearing officer shall
issue his or her findings and decision, in writing, within ten (10) business
days to the licensee and the Director of the Finance Department. The findings
and decision of the administrative hearing officer shall constitute a final
order to the licensee.
(Ord. 2017-8-92. Passed 8-23-17.)
   347.99 PENALTIES.
   Any person who violates any provision of this chapter for which a penalty is
not already provided in another section of this Traffic Code is guilty of a
minor degree misdemeanor and shall be fined not more than one hundred dollars
($100.00). In addition to any other method of enforcement provided for in this
chapter, any violation of the provisions of this chapter which is a minor
misdemeanor may be enforced by the issuance of a citation in compliance with
Rule 4.1 of the Ohio Rules of Criminal Procedure.
(Ord. 2017-8-92. Passed 8-23-17.)
CHAPTER 349
Low-Speed for Hire Vehicles
349.01   Definitions.
349.02   Licenses required.
349.03   Inspection.
349.04   Liability insurance.
349.05   License card.
349.06   Fee for low-speed for hire vehicles.
349.07   Low-speed for hire vehicle license; application.
349.08   Issuance or denial of a license.
349.09   Fees for low-speed for hire vehicle operator’s license.
349.10   Regulation of low-speed for hire vehicles.
349.11   Specifically charted low-speed for hire vehicles.
349.12   License suspension or revocation.
349.13   Appeal from license denial, suspension or revocation.
349.14   Articles left in vehicles.
349.99    Penalties.
   349.01 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this Chapter the words and phrases defined in the
sections hereunder shall have the meanings therein respectively ascribed to
them, unless a different meaning is clearly indicated by the context.
   (a)    "Codified Ordinances" shall mean the Codified Ordinances of the City
of Hamilton, Ohio.
   (b)    "Low speed vehicle" shall means a three- or four-wheeled motor
vehicle with an attainable speed in one mile on a paved level surface of more
than twenty (20) miles per hour but not more than twenty-five (25) miles per
hour and with a gross vehicle weight rating less than three thousand (3,000)
pounds.
      (ORC 4501.01(WW)).
   (c)    "Public Vehicle" shall mean a vehicle, other than a charitable non-
profit transportation vehicle, by which individual service for compensation in
the transportation of persons on the public streets is furnished or offered be
furnished. Vehicles offering service in the transportation of persons on the
public streets for hire, fee, or compensation of any kind, including
compensation derived from tips or advertising, are public vehicles.
   (d)    "Low-speed for hire vehicle" is any low speed vehicle that is
operated as a public vehicle.
   (e)    "Director of Engineering" shall mean the City of Hamilton Director of
Engineering and/or his or her designee.
   (f)    "Director of Finance" shall mean the City of Hamilton Director of
Finance and/or his or her designee.
   (g)    "Chief of Police" shall mean the City of Hamilton Chief of Police
and/or his or her designee.
   (h)    "City Manager" shall mean the City of Hamilton City Manager and/or
his or her designee. (Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-14-22.)
   349.02 LICENSES REQUIRED.
   (a)    No person shall operate a low-speed for hire vehicle upon the public
streets and/or alleys of the City without obtaining a valid low-speed for hire
vehicle license from the Director of Finance. Such license shall be issued for
the calendar year and shall expire on December 31 of each year, unless sooner
suspended or revoked by the Director of Finance.
   (b)    No person shall operate a low-speed for hire vehicle upon the public
streets and/or alleys of the City without obtaining a valid operator's license
from the Director of Finance. Such license shall be issued for the calendar
year and shall expire on December 31 of each year, unless sooner suspended or
revoked by the Director of Finance.
   (c)    Application for a license for low-speed for hire vehicles and low-
speed for hire vehicle operator's license shall be made by the owner upon blank
forms furnished by the Director of Finance, and shall comply with the revisions
of this Chapter.
(Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-14-22.)
   349.03 INSPECTION.
   No low-speed for hire vehicle shall be licensed until the same has been
thoroughly and carefully inspected, examined, and found to be in a thoroughly
safe condition for the transportation of passengers, clean, fit, of good
appearance, and well painted or varnished. Such inspection shall be made by the
Chief of Police before issuing such license, and he or she may make such
additional inspections as in his or her judgment are necessary. The Chief of
Police shall refuse a license to, or revoke or suspend the license of any
vehicle found by him or her to be unfit or unsuited for public patronage. The
Chief of Police is hereby authorized and empowered to establish reasonable
rules and regulations for the inspection and operation of low-speed for hire
vehicles, their appurtenances, construction and conditional fitness.
(Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-14-22.)
   349.04 LIABILITY INSURANCE.
   No person shall operate a low-speed for hire vehicle or other vehicle as
defined in this chapter or permit such to be operated; nor shall any license be
issued hereunder until and unless the applicant for a license hereunder
deposits with the Director of Finance a policy or certificate of commercial
general liability insurance for each low-speed for hire vehicle for which a
license is sought, acceptable and approved by the Director of Finance and the
Director of Law, insuring the applicant against bodily injury and property
damage with limits of one million dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence, two
million dollars ($2,000,000) annual aggregate. The policy shall afford coverage
to the City of Hamilton as an additional insured. The issuing insurer shall
give ten (10) days written notice before cancellation of the policy to the
Director of Finance. Any license issued under this Chapter shall expire upon
the lapse or termination of the policy of insurance. (Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-
14-22.)
   349.05 LICENSE CARD.
   Any low-speed for hire vehicle which has been found upon inspection to be of
lawful construction and proper condition in accordance with this chapter and
rules and regulations established thereunder and upon the payment of the
license fees hereinafter set forth shall be licensed by delivering to the owner
a card of such size and form as may be prescribed by the City of Hamilton
Director of Finance. The card shall contain an official license number together
with date of inspection of such vehicle and the statement that in case of any
complaints, the Police Department shall be notified. Such card shall be signed
by a representative from the Police Department and contain blank spaces upon
which entry shall be made of the date of every inspection. The number of such
card shall correspond with the license number of such vehicle, and shall be
displayed conspicuously in the low-speed or hire vehicle as prescribed by the
Director of Finance. (Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-14-22.)
   349.06 FEES FOR LOW-SPEED FOR HIRE VEHICLES.
   (a)    No person shall operate or permit to be operated any vehicle as a
low-speed for hire vehicle, or shall proffer the services of such vehicles as a
low-speed for hire vehicle by solicitation by voice, sign, public
advertisement, light, or otherwise unless the proper license has been issued
for the vehicle to the own thereof and is in force.
   (b)    Every license shall expire on December 31st of the year following the
date on which the license was issued. License fees for each low-speed for hire
vehicle shall be payable to the City of Hamilton in the following amounts:
      (1)    One hundred and fifty dollars ($150.00); after June 30th of each
year, the amount shall be seventy-five dollars ($75.00).
   (c)    Any licensee upon payment of any of the above fees, shall be entitled
to operate as low-speed for hire vehicle during such year additional vehicles
for which low-speed for hire vehicle licenses have been issued and are in
effect or which are otherwise licensed for the transportation of persons for
hire in the City of Hamilton, upon payment of an additional annual fee of five
dollars ($5.00) for each such vehicle; provided the Director of Law is
satisfied that the public liability insurance on such vehicle covers.
   (d)    No transfer of a license shall be permitted except with the consent
of the Director of Finance, which consent shall be endorsed on the original
license. The Director of Finance shall permit a transfer only when it appears
that one (1) of the cars owned and operated by the licensee is retired,
destroyed, demolished or otherwise rendered unfit for service.
   (e)    Upon a finding by the City of Hamilton Director of Finance that an
extraordinary demand upon any special occasion requires the use of more low-
speed for hire vehicles by any person, firm or corporation to whom there has
been issued one (1) or more low-speed for hire license for the calendar year,
the Director of Finance may issue special permits, valid for a period not to
exceed twenty-four (24) hours, upon the payment of a fee of one dollar ($1.00)
each for the use of additional vehicles which are duly licensed for the
transportation of persons for hire and which carry public liability insurance
satisfactory to the Director of Law.
(Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-14-22.)
   349.07 LOW-SPEED FOR HIRE VEHICLE LICENSE; APPLICATION.
   (a)    Each application for a low-speed for hire vehicle license shall
contain the name and address of the applicant the name and address of the
vehicle's owner if different than the applicant; the trade name under which the
business is to be conducted; the hours and days of operation; the proposed area
to be served; the type of vehicle including age, condition and intended use;
the applicant's public vehicle history; the procedures to train driver; whether
the vehicle will be driven by someone other than the applicant; and the
maintenance of the vehicle. The proposed operating zones or permitted routes,
hours, and days of operation for each low-speed for hire vehicle shall be
reviewed for public safety purposes by the Police Department and Engineering
Department. The owner of a vehicle shall also comply with all requirements of
Ohio law regarding proper title, registration, and license plates prior to
operating the vehicle on any public street and/or alley.
   (b)   Every person driving a low-speed for hire vehicle shall be licensed as
a low-speed for hire vehicle operator and each applicant must:
      (1)    Be licensed by the State of Ohio to operate a motor vehicle;
      (2)    Be twenty-one (21) years of age or over;
      (3)    Not be currently engaging in the illegal use of alcohol or drugs;
      (4)    Cleared by a criminal background check, which is completed by a
law enforcement entity, association, corporation, or firm approved by the City
Manager to perform such services;
      (5)    Shall produce satisfactory evidence that the applicant has
completed a course in first aid and lifesaving, approved by the Chief of
Police, and in addition, a certificate from a reputable physician stating that
the applicant is free from communicable diseases;
      (6)    Provide two (2) front face photographs of the applicant taken
within thirty (30) days of the date of the application. The photographs shall
be two (2) inches by two (2) inches in size; and
      (7)    Provide such other information as the Director of Finance may
require.
         (Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-15-22.)
   349.08 ISSUANCE OR DENIAL OF A LICENSE.
   (a)    If the applicant meets all the requirements set forth in this
chapter, his/her criminal background check did not disclose convictions for
felony crimes of violence, weapons, or moral turpitude, or misdemeanor
convictions of moral turpitude and he/she is not non-compliant as stated in
Chapter
701, "General License Provisions of the Codified Ordinances" then the Director
of Finance shall issue a low-speed for hire vehicle license and/or a low-speed
for hire vehicle operator's license to applicant upon payment of the proper
fee.
   (b)    If the Director of Finance denies the issuance of a low-speed for
hire vehicle and/or a low-speed for hire vehicle operator's license, the
director shall send notice to the applicant-supplied address, or if applicable,
the notice shall be provided to the applicant in person if the individual is
present in the office of the director at the time of the denial.
   (c)    No low-speed for hire vehicle and/or a low-speed for hire vehicle
operator's license shall be issued to an applicant who makes a false statement
in connection with an application for such license.
   (d)    A Low-speed for hire vehicle and/or low-speed for hire vehicle
operator's license shall be issued for the calendar year and shall expire on
December 31 of each year, unless sooner, suspended or revoked by the Director
of Finance.
(Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-14-22.)
   349.09 FEES FOR LOW-SPEED FOR HIRE VEHICLE OPERATOR'S LICENSE.
   Every driver of a low-speed for hire vehicle shall pay to the Director of
Finance the sum of forty dollars ($40.00) upon issuance of an operator's
license, and the sum of twenty dollars ($20.00) per year for each annual
renewal.
(Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-14-22.)
   349.10 REGULATION OF LOW-SPEED FOR HIRE VEHICLES.
   (a)    The Director of Finance, Director of Engineering, and Chief of Police
shall establish, and from time to time may amend, revoke or add to, such rules
and regulations for the administration of this chapter and such regulations
shall be available to the public in person or on the City website.
   (b)    No person shall operate a low-speed for hire vehicle within the City
of Hamilton contrary to regulations promulgated pursuant to Section
349.10.
(Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-14-22.)
   349.11 SPECIFICALLY CHARTED LOW-SPEED FOR HIRE VEHICLES.
   Only low-speed for hire vehicles in such numbers as provided herein shall
remain while awaiting employment, at the route start or stop points approved by
the City of Hamilton Department of Engineering pursuant to Section
349.10. The Engineering Department shall determine the number and location of
any public stands, and shall establish such further regulations not
inconsistent with the provisions of this chapter as the Director of that
Department deems necessary. The owner of a low-speed for hire vehicle licensed
as provided in this chapter may load or unload a group of passengers at such
point or points in the City as may have been agreed upon in advance by the
person, firm or corporation chartering such low-speed for hire vehicle subject
to the approval of the City of Hamilton Engineering Department or the Police
Department. (Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-14-22.)
   349.12 LICENSE SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION.
   (a)    In addition to any penalty imposed and authorized by any section of
this chapter, the Director of Finance may at any time suspend or revoke any
license granted under authority of this chapter for any of the following as
applicable:
      (1)    Defacing any license, identification or rate card, or for
tampering with or altering the rate card;
      (2)    Conviction of operating a vehicle while under the influence (OVI)
of drugs or alcohol as provided in Ohio Revised Code Chapter 4511 or the
corresponding criminal provision in other states, while licensed as a public
vehicle driver in the City, regardless of whether the driver was operating a
public vehicle at the time of arrest for OVI;
      (3)    Suspension of his/her state issued driver's license from the
Bureau of Motor Vehicles;
      (4)    Physical or mental incapability to drive;
      (5)    Obtaining the low-speed for hire operator's license through false
statements;
      (6)    Conviction of a felony crime of violence, weapons, or moral
turpitude or misdemeanor involving moral turpitude; or
      (7)    Failure to comply with the provisions of this chapter or with any
other applicable laws or regulations of the City or the State of Ohio.
   (b)    A suspended license may be reinstated within fifteen (15) days of its
suspension if the reason for the suspension is cured by the licensee. Any
license that is not reinstated within fifteen (15) days of its suspension shall
be deemed revoked.
   (c)    Whenever the Director of Finance suspends or revokes a license, the
Director of Finance shall issue written notice of suspension or revocation to
the applicant or licensee. The notice shall be served on the applicant or
licensee personally or by United States certified mail or commercial carrier
service to the address provided by the applicant or licensee to the Director of
Finance. If the certified mail is returned undelivered or the commercial
carrier service reports a failure of delivery, a copy shall be served by
regular mail. If notice is sent by regular mail, it shall be evidenced by a
certificate of mailing and shall be deemed received three (3) business days
from the date of mailing.
(Ord. 2022-73. Passed 9-14-22.)
   349.13 APPEAL FROM LICENSE DENIAL, SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION.
   (a)    In case any applicant is denied any license, or his application
therefor is disapproved by any officer whose approval is requisite for its
issuance, or the report upon any investigation or inspection requisite to a
license is unfavorable, or any license is suspended or revoked, the applicant
or licensee shall within three business days have the right to appeal to the
City Manager from such denial, disapproval, unfavorable report, suspension or
revocation, in such manner and upon such forms as the City Manager shall
prescribe. Whenever application is made for any such appeal the Manager shall
forthwith fix a time and place for hearing the same, not later than one week
thereafter. Upon such hearing the applicant or licensee shall be heard in
person or by counsel, to prove that his application should be granted or his
license restored, and upon no other subject. Evidence may be heard in rebuttal
of that offered by the appellant. The City Manager shall render his decision
within three days after the close of such hearing, either confirming the
denial, disapproval, report, suspension, or revocation, or ordering the license
to be issued or to be restored. Any order for the issuance or restoration of a
license may stipulate as a condition thereof the correction of conditions to
comply with requirements governing such licenses. Upon the final revocation of
any license the license certificate thereof shall be cancelled, and a record
thereof made by the Director of Finance. A license which has been revoked shall
not be renewed, nor shall another license be issued to the same person for the
same business or occupation during the remainder of the year for which the
revoked license was issued, unless the City Manager so orders For purposes of
appeal the Director of Finance's decision shall be presumed accurate, and the
appellant shall bear the burden of proof of evidence to contradict the
director's decision. The administrative hearing officer will either uphold or
reverse the director's decision based on the information presented at the
hearing under the criteria set forth in this Chapter.
(Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-14-22.)
   349.14 ARTICLES LEFT IN VEHICLES.
   Drivers of low-speed for hire vehicles shall promptly deliver to the Police
Department, or to the authorized agencies of their companies, all property of
value left in such vehicles by passengers.
(Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-14-22.)
   349.99 PENALTIES.
   (a)    Except as otherwise provided in this Chapter, whoever violates
Section 349.02 of this Chapter is guilty of a minor misdemeanor. If within one
year of the offense, the offender previously has been convicted of or pleaded
guilty to a violation of this Chapter, whoever violates Section 349.02 is
guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree.
   (b)    Any person who violates any provision of this chapter for which a
penalty is not already provided in another section of this Chapter is guilty of
a minor misdemeanor and shall be fined up to one hundred and fifty dollars
($150.00). In addition to any other method of enforcement provided for in this
Chapter, any violation of the provisions of this chapter which is a minor
misdemeanor may be enforced by the issuance of a citation in compliance with
Rule 4.1 of the Ohio Rules of Criminal Procedure.
(Ord. 2022-9-73. Passed 9-14-22.)
CHAPTER 350
Commercial Quadricycles Pilot Program
350.01    Definitions.
350.03    Regulation of commercial quadricycles.
350.05    Specifically charted commercial quadricycle.
350.07    Licenses required.
350.09    Liability insurance.
350.11    License card.
350.13    Inspection.
350.15    Commercial quadricycle license; application; fees.
350.17    Commercial quadricycle operator’s license; application; fees.
350.19    Issuance or denial of a license.
350.21    License suspension or revocation.
350.23   Appeal from license denial, suspension or revocation.
350.25    Opened container of beer or intoxicating liquor prohibited,
exceptions.
350.99    Penalty.
   350.01 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this Chapter, the words and phrases defined in the
sections hereunder shall have the meanings therein respectively ascribed to
them, unless a different meaning is clearly indicated by the context.
   (a)    "Codified Ordinances" shall mean the Codified Ordinances of the City
of Hamilton, Ohio.
   (b)    "Commercial Quadricycle" shall mean a vehicle that has fully-
operative pedals for propulsion entirely by human power and that meets all of
the following requirements:
      (1)    It has four (4) wheels and is operated in a manner similar to a
bicycle.
      (2)    It has at least five (5) seats for passengers.
      (3)    It is designed to be powered by the pedaling of the operator and
the passengers.
      (4)    It is used for commercial purposes.
      (5)    It is operated by the vehicle owner or an employee of the owner.
[ORC 4301.62(F)(3)].
   (c)    "Director of Engineering" shall mean the City of Hamilton Director of
Engineering and/or his or her designee.
   (d)   "Director of Finance" shall mean the City of Hamilton Director of
Finance and/or his or her designee.
   (e)    "Chief of Police" shall mean the City of Hamilton Chief of Police
and/or his or her designee.
   (f)   "City Manager" shall mean the City of Hamilton City Manager and/or his
or her designee. (Ord. 2023-7-66. Passed 7-12-23.)
 
   350.03 REGULATION OF COMMERCIAL QUADRICYCLES.
   (a)   The Director of Finance, Director of Engineering, and Chief of Police
shall establish, and from time to time may amend, revoke or add to, such rules
and regulations for the administration of this ordinance and such regulations
shall be available to the public in person or on the City website.
      (1)    Pilot Program. The rules and regulations promulgated by the
Finance, Director of Engineering, and Chief of Police for the Pilot Program
shall be for a period of three (3) years unless otherwise earlier terminated by
ordinance. Prior to the expiration of the time for the Pilot Program, the
Director of Engineering shall make a report to Council with recommendations for
retention, termination, or modification of the program.
   (b)   All passengers of a commercial quadricycle within the City shall be
twenty-one (21) years of age or older.
   (c)    No person shall operate a commercial quadricycle within the City of
Hamilton contrary to regulations promulgated pursuant to Section
 350.03 or contrary to federal, state, or local law. (Ord. 2023-7-66. Passed 7-
12-23.)
   350.05 SPECIFICALLY CHARTED COMMERCIAL QUADRICYCLE.
   The Engineering Department shall determine the number and location of any
public stands, and shall establish such further regulations not inconsistent
with the provisions of this chapter as the Director of that Department deems
necessary. The owner of a commercial quadricycle licensed as provided in this
Chapter may load or unload a group of passengers at such point or points in the
City as may have been agreed upon in advance by the person, firm or corporation
chartering such commercial quadricycle subject to the approval of the City of
Hamilton Engineering Department or the Police Department.
(Ord. 2023-7-66. Passed 7-12-23.)
   350.07 LICENSES REQUIRED.
   No person shall solicit, drive, operate, or otherwise be in physical control
of any commercial quadricycle for the purpose of carrying the public generally
as passengers for hire, gift, donation, or other consideration unless:
   (a)   The commercial quadricycle is validly licensed by the City of Hamilton
pursuant to this Chapter;
   (b)   Each operator of the licensed commercial quadricycle has a valid
commercial quadricycle operator's license;
   (c)   Each quadricycle and operator is insured for liability coverage as
required under the provisions of Section
350.09; and
   (d)   The current license card is clearly displayed on the quadricycle.
      (Ord. 2023-7-66. Passed 7-12-23.)
   350.09 LIABILITY INSURANCE.
   No person shall operate any commercial quadricycle as defined in this
chapter or permit such to be operated; nor shall any license be issued
hereunder until and unless the applicant for a license hereunder obtains a
policy or certificate of commercial general liability insurance for each
commercial quadricycle, insuring the applicant against bodily injury and
property damage with limits of one million dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence,
two million dollars ($2,000,000) annual aggregate. The policy shall afford
coverage to the City of Hamilton as an additional insured. Said policy for
which a license is sought shall be acceptable and approved by the Director of
Finance and the Director of Law, and promptly deposited with the Finance
Department upon request by the Director of Finance. The issuing insurer shall
give ten (10) days written notice before cancellation of the policy to the
Director of Finance. Any license issued under this Chapter shall expire upon
the lapse or termination of the policy of insurance.
(Ord. 2023-7-66. Passed 7-12-23.)
   350.11 LICENSE CARD.
   Any commercial quadricycle which has been found upon inspection to be of
lawful construction and proper condition in accordance with this chapter and
rules and regulations established thereunder and upon the payment of the
license fees hereinafter set forth shall be licensed by delivering to the owner
a card of such size and form as may be prescribed by the City of Hamilton
Director of Finance, as long the maximum number of cards have not been issued
under the rules and regulations. The card shall contain an official license
number together with date of inspection of such commercial quadricycle and the
statement that in case of any complaints, the Police Department shall be
notified. Such card shall be signed by a representative from the Police
Department and contain blank spaces upon which entry shall be made of the date
of every inspection. The number of such card shall correspond with the license
number of such commercial quadricycle, and shall be displayed conspicuously in
the commercial quadricycles prescribed by the Director of Finance.
(Ord. 2023-7-66. Passed 7-12-23.)
   350.13 INSPECTION.
   No commercial quadricycle shall be licensed until the same has been
thoroughly and carefully inspected, examined, and found to be in a thoroughly
safe condition for the transportation of passengers, clean, fit, of good
appearance, and well painted or varnished. Such inspection shall be made by the
Chief of Police before issuing such license, and he or she may make such
additional inspections as in his or her judgment are necessary. The Chief of
Police shall refuse a license to, or revoke or suspend the license of any
commercial quadricycle found by him or her to be unfit or unsuited for public
patronage. The Chief of Police is hereby authorized and empowered to establish
reasonable rules and regulations for the inspection and operation of commercial
quadricycle, their appurtenances, construction and conditional fitness.
(Ord. 2023-7-66. Passed 7-12-23.)
   350.15 COMMERCIAL QUADRICYCLE LICENSE; APPLICATION; FEES.
   (a)   No person shall operate or permit to be operated any commercial
quadricycle, or shall proffer the services of such commercial quadricycle by
solicitation by voice, sign, public advertisement, light, or otherwise without
a valid commercial quadricycle license issued pursuant to this Chapter.
   (b)   Each application for a commercial quadricycle license shall contain
the name and address of the applicant; the name and address of the commercial
quadricycle's owner if different than the applicant; the trade name under which
the business is to be conducted; the hours and days of operation; the proposed
area to be served; the seating capacity of the commercial quadricycle, the
condition of the commercial quadricycle, including age, condition and intended
use; the procedures to train operators; whether the commercial quadricycle will
be operated by someone other than the applicant; and any other information
required by the Director of Finance. The proposed operating zones or permitted
routes, hours, and days of operation for each commercial quadricycle shall be
reviewed for public safety purposes by the Police Department and Engineering
Department. The owner of a commercial quadricycle shall also comply with all
requirements of the City of Hamilton and the State of Ohio traffic laws.
   (c)   Every license shall expire on December 31st of each year unless sooner
suspended or revoked by the Director of Finance. License fees for each
commercial quadricycle shall be payable to the City of Hamilton in the
following amounts:
      (1)   One hundred and fifty dollars ($150.00); after June 30th of each
year, the amount shall be seventy-five dollars ($75.00).
   (d)   No transfer of a license shall be permitted except with the consent of
the Director of Finance, which consent shall be endorsed on the original
license. The Director of Finance shall permit a transfer only when it appears
that one (1) of the commercial quadricycle owned and operated by the licensee
is retired, destroyed, demolished or otherwise rendered unfit for service.
   (e)    Upon a finding by the City of Hamilton Director of Finance that an
extraordinary demand upon any special occasion requires the use of more
commercial quadricycle by any person, firm or corporation to whom there has
been issued one (1) or more commercial quadricycle license for the calendar
year, the Director of Finance may issue special permits, valid for a period not
to exceed twenty-four (24) hours, upon the payment of a fee of one dollar
($1.00) each for the use of additional commercial quadricycles which are duly
licensed for the transportation of persons for hire and which carry public
liability insurance satisfactory to the Director of Law. (Ord. 2023-7-66.
Passed 7-12-23.)
   350.17 COMMERCIAL QUADRICYCLE OPERATOR'S LICENSE; APPLICATION; FEES.
   (a)    Every person driving a commercial quadricycle operator shall be
licensed as a commercial quadricycle operator and each applicant must:
      (1)    Be licensed by the State of Ohio to operate a motor vehicle;
      (2)    Be twenty-one (21) years of age or over;
      (3)    Not be currently engaging in the illegal use of alcohol or drugs;
      (4)    Cleared by a criminal background check, which is completed by a
law enforcement entity, association, corporation, or firm approved by the City
Manager to perform such services;
      (5)    Shall produce satisfactory evidence that the applicant has
completed a course in first aid and lifesaving, approved by the Chief of
Police, and in addition, be in sound physical condition, have good eyesight and
not subject to any infirmity, defect or disorder of mind or body which might
reasonably render him/her unfit for the safe carrying out of the duties of a
commercial quadricycle operator;
      (6)    Provide two (2) front face photographs of the applicant taken
within thirty (30) days of the date of the application. The photographs shall
be two (2) inches by two (2) inches in size; and
      (7)   Provide such other information as the Director of Finance may
require.
   (b)    Every license shall be issued for the calendar year and shall expire
on December 31 of each year, unless sooner suspended or revoked by the Director
of Finance. License fees for each commercial quadricycle shall be payable to
the City of Hamilton in the following amounts:
      (1)   Forty dollars ($40.00) upon issuance of an operator's license, and
the sum of twenty dollars ($20.00) per year for each annual renewal.
   (c)   No transfer of a commercial operator license shall be permitted.
(Ord. 2023-7-66. Passed 7-12-23.)
  
   350.19 ISSUANCE OR DENIAL OF A LICENSE.
   (a)    If the applicant meets all the requirements set forth in this
chapter, he/she is not non-compliant as stated in Chapter
701, "General License Provisions," then the Director of Finance shall issue a
commercial quadricycle license to applicant upon payment of the proper fee.
   (b)    If the Director of Finance denies the issuance of a commercial
quadricycle license, the director shall send notice to the applicant-supplied
address, or if applicable, the notice shall be provided to the applicant in
person if the individual is present in the office of the director at the time
of the denial.
   (c)    No commercial quadricycle license shall be issued to an applicant who
makes a false statement in connection with an application for such license.
   (d)    No commercial quadricycle operator license shall be issued to an
applicant who makes a false statement in connection with an application for
such license.
   (e)   A Commercial quadricycle license shall be issued for the calendar year
and shall expire on December 31 of each year, unless sooner, suspended or
revoked by the Director of Finance. (Ord. 2023-7-66. Passed 7-12-23.)
   350.21 LICENSE SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION.
   (a)   In addition to any penalty imposed and authorized by any section of
this chapter, the Director of Finance may at any time suspend or revoke any
license granted under authority of this chapter for any of the following as
applicable:
      (1)   Defacing any license, identification or rate card, or for tampering
with or altering the rate card;
      (2)   Conviction of operating a vehicle while under the influence (OVI)
of drugs or alcohol as provided in Ohio Revised Code Chapter 4511 or the
corresponding criminal provision in other states, while licensed as a
commercial quadricycle operator in the City;
      (3)   Suspension of his/her state issued driver's license from the Bureau
of Motor Vehicles;
      (4)   Physical or mental incapability to drive;
      (5)   Obtaining the commercial quadricycle license or commercial
quadricycle operator's license through false statements;
      (6)   Conviction of a felony crime of violence, weapons, or moral
turpitude or misdemeanor involving moral turpitude; or
      (7)   Failure to comply with the provisions of this chapter or with any
other applicable laws or regulations of the City or the State of Ohio.
   (b)   A suspended license may be reinstated within fifteen (15) days of its
suspension if the reason for the suspension is cured by the licensee. Any
license that is not reinstated within fifteen (15) days of its suspension shall
be deemed revoked.
   (c)   Whenever the Director of Finance suspends or revokes a license, the
Director of Finance shall issue written notice of suspension or revocation to
the applicant or licensee. The notice shall be served on the applicant or
licensee personally or by United States certified mail or commercial carrier
service to the address provided by the applicant or licensee to the Director of
Finance. If the certified mail is returned undelivered or the commercial
carrier service reports a failure of delivery, a copy shall be served by
regular mail. If notice is sent by regular mail, it shall be evidenced by a
certificate of mailing and shall be deemed received three (3) business days
from the date of mailing. (Ord. 2023-7-66. Passed 7-12-23.)
   350.23 APPEAL FROM LICENSE DENIAL, SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION.
   (a)   In case any applicant is denied any license, or his application
therefor is disapproved by any officer whose approval is requisite for its
issuance, or the report upon any investigation or inspection requisite to a
license is unfavorable, or any license is suspended or revoked, the applicant
or licensee shall within three business days have the right to appeal to the
City Manager from such denial, disapproval, unfavorable report, suspension or
revocation, in such manner and upon such forms as the City Manager shall
prescribe. Whenever application is made for any such appeal the Manager shall
forthwith fix a time and place for hearing the same, not later than one week
thereafter. Upon such hearing the applicant or licensee shall be heard in
person or by counsel, to prove that his application should be granted or his
license restored, and upon no other subject. Evidence may be heard in rebuttal
of that offered by the appellant. The City Manager shall render his decision
within three days after the close of such hearing, either confirming the
denial, disapproval, report, suspension, or revocation, or ordering the license
to be issued or to be restored. Any order for the issuance or restoration of a
license may stipulate as a condition thereof the correction of conditions to
comply with requirements governing such licenses. Upon the final revocation of
any license, the license certificate thereof shall be cancelled, and a record
thereof made by the Director of Finance. A license which has been revoked shall
not be renewed, nor shall another license be issued to the same person for the
same business or occupation during the remainder of the year for which the
revoked license was issued, unless the City Manager so orders For purposes of
appeal the Director of Finance's decision shall be presumed accurate, and the
appellant shall bear the burden of proof of evidence to contradict the
director's decision. The administrative hearing officer will either uphold or
reverse the director's decision based on the information presented at the
hearing under the criteria set forth in this Chapter. (Ord. 2023-7-66. Passed
7-12-23.)
   350.25 OPENED CONTAINER OF BEER OR INTOXICATING LIQUOR PROHIBITED,
EXCEPTIONS.
   (a)    Section
 529.07, Open Container Prohibited, of the Codified Ordinances of the City of
Hamilton, Ohio prohibiting the opened container of beer or intoxicating liquor
does not apply to a person who, pursuant to a prearranged contract, is a
passenger riding on a commercial quadricycle when all of the following apply:
      (1)    The person is not occupying a seat in the front of the commercial
quadricycle where the operator is steering or braking.
      (2)   The commercial quadricycle is being operated on a street, highway,
or other public or private property open to the public for purposes of
vehicular travel or parking within all Community Entertainment Districts as
established by Ordinance.
      (3)    The person has in their possession on the commercial quadricycle
an opened, non-glass container of beer or wine.
      (4)    The person has in their possession on the commercial quadricycle
not more than either thirty-six ounces of beer or eighteen ounces of wine.
         (Ord. 2023-7-66. Passed 7-12-23.)
   350.99 PENALTY.
   (a)   Whoever violates Section
350.07 of this chapter shall be guilty of operation of a commercial quadricycle
without a license. A violation of Section
350.07 is a minor misdemeanor, if the offender has not previously been
convicted of or pleaded guilty to a violation of that section within one year
immediately preceding the offense. If within one year immediately preceding the
offense, the offender previously has been convicted of or pleaded guilty to a
violation of this Chapter, then a violation of Section
350.07 a misdemeanor of the fourth degree.
   (b)   Whoever violates Section
350.03(b) or (c) shall be guilty of the improper conduct as a commercial
quadricycle passenger, a minor misdemeanor.
   (c)   Any person who violates any provision of this chapter for which a
penalty is not already provided in another section of this Traffic Code shall
be guilty of illegal operation of a commercial quadricycle, a minor
misdemeanor. In addition to any other method of enforcement provided for in
this Chapter, any violation of the provisions of this chapter which is a minor
misdemeanor may be enforced by the issuance of a citation in compliance with
Rule 4.1 of the Ohio Rules of Criminal Procedure.
   (d)   The remedies listed in this chapter are not exclusive of any other
remedies available to the City under any applicable federal, state or local law
and it is within the discretion of the City to seek cumulative remedies.
(Ord. 2023-7-66. Passed 7-12-23.)
